text: Lucina Elena da Costa Gomez-Matheeuws (5 April 1929 - 7 January 2017) was a Dutch Antillean politician for the National People's Party (PNP). She served as the Prime Minister of the Netherlands Antilles, an office her husband Moises Frumencio da Costa Gomez previously held, briefly in 1977. She was also the first female to hold the office. Prior to this, she was the Minister of Health and Environment, Welfare, Youth, Sports, Culture and Recreation (1970-1977). Costa Gomez-Matheeuws died on 7 January 2017 at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Prime Ministers of the Netherlands Antilles Category:Government ministers of the Netherlands Antilles Category:Members of the Estates of the Netherlands Antilles Category:Dutch Antillean women in politics Category:Curaçao women in politics Category:National People's Party (Curaçao) politicians Category:Place of birth missing Category:20th-century Dutch women politicians Category:20th- century Dutch politicians Category:Women prime ministers
title: Lucina da Costa Gomez-Matheeuws
